courseDescription: An intensive course in taxation.  Focuses on the choice of business entity by covering taxation of corporations (both C and S corporations), partnerships and sole proprietor-ships.  The course emphasizes research skills and professional ethics.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of C and S corporations taxation

courseDescription: Covers federal income taxation of corporations and shareholders. Includes organizing a corporation; establishing capital structure; determining tax liability; dividends and other non-liquidating distributions; stock redemptions; and liquidations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of federal income taxation of corporations
Knowledge of dividends and other non-liquidating distributions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing corporate financial data for tax purposes

courseDescription: Taxation of partners and partnerships: formation, termination, distributions and liquidations, and sales of partnership interests.  Limited partnerships in conjunction with their use as tax shelters, and the multifaceted attributes of family partnerships.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge on formation, termination, distributions and liquidations of partnerships
Understanding of limited partnerships and their use as tax shelters
Familiarity with attributes of family partnerships
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex tax concepts
Ability to negotiate and mediate in tax-related disputes
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of partnership structures and their tax implications

courseDescription: Examines transfers under federal estate and gift tax laws.  Includes property owned by the decedent; retained life estates; transfers taking effect at death; transfers with retained powers; concurrent property interest; powers of appointment; valuation problems; expenses, debts, and taxes; charitable bequests; marital deduction; taxable inter vivos gifts; gift splitting and credits; consideration of Chapter 14 and asset freezing techniques; and transfer taxation of life insurance.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of federal estate and gift tax laws
Familiarity with transfer taxation of life insurance
Understanding of transfers with retained powers
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex tax laws
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of estate and gift tax laws
Analytical review of inter vivos gifts

courseTitle: Income Taxation of Estates, Trusts & Beneficiaries
courseDescription: Examines simple, complex, and revocable trusts; trusts accumulation distributions; income in respect of decedents; trust accounting income; distributable net income; terminations; excess deductions; basis rules; and the decedent's final income tax return.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of simple, complex, and revocable trusts
Comprehension of income in respect of decedents
Knowledge of decedent's final income tax return
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading client meetings on tax matters

courseDescription: Analyzes the different types of taxable and tax-free acquisitions and reorganizations.  Includes determining tax consequences for corporations and shareholders involved in an acquisition or reorganization and analyzing necessary requirements for a tax-free corporate division (spin-off).  Covers aspects of filing consolidated federal income tax returns.
Technical and Digital Skills: Determining tax consequences for corporations and shareholders
Analyzing requirements for tax-free corporate division
Filing consolidated federal income tax returns
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing tax implications of acquisitions and reorganizations
Identifying tax-free opportunities in corporate divisions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing tax-related aspects of corporate reorganizations

courseDescription: Discusses federal income taxation of deferred compensation plans with emphasis on qualified retirement plans.  Reviews plan qualification requirements, reporting and disclosure requirements, and distribution rules.  Includes discussion of specific types of plans such as Sec. 401(K) and ESOPs.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of reporting and disclosure requirements
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to discuss complex tax concepts
Ability to explain different types of deferred compensation plans
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Compliance with tax reporting and disclosure requirements

courseDescription: Examines state levying of individual income, corporate income, property, sales, and excise taxes.

Taxation of foreign persons conducting business in the U.S. including FIRPTA, source of income rules, and residency requirements; taxation of U.S. individuals and businesses doing business abroad including FSCs, CFCs, FHP Co's and possessions corporations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of source of income rules
Comprehension of FSCs, CFCs, FHP Co's taxation
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining complex tax regulations to clients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing tax implications for various business scenarios
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing tax compliance for international businesses

courseDescription: Covers determination of realized and recognized gains and losses and their tax treatment on property dispositions.  Includes consequences of property transactions, such as depreciation, depletion, basis and capital gains problems.
Technical and Digital Skills: Determination of realized and recognized gains and losses
Understanding of tax treatment on property dispositions
Calculation of basis and capital gains
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of tax implications on property transactions

courseTitle: Taxation of the Small Business Corporation
courseDescription: Covers federal income taxation of S corporations including election eligibility; termination of status; treatment of income and deduction items; distributions; and basis of stock and debt.  Also discusses compensation arrangements in closely held corporations; fiscal year issues; personal service corporations; the advantages of C corporations versus S corporations; corporation liquidation and redemption rules; and the S corporations' built-in gains tax.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of federal income taxation of S corporations
Understanding of treatment of income and deduction items
Understanding of corporation liquidation and redemption rules
Knowledge of S corporations' built-in gains tax
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex tax issues to clients
Ability to discuss compensation arrangements in closely held corporations
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze fiscal year issues
Ability to assess advantages of C corporations versus S corporations

courseDescription: Discusses procedures for dealing with the IRS.  Includes sources of IRS policy; processing returns; auditing returns; rulings and determination letters; assessments and collections; and interest and civil penalties.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of IRS policies and procedures
Interpretation of rulings and determination letters
Understanding of interest and civil penalties
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex tax procedures to clients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing tax return data for accuracy
Problem-solving in disputes with IRS rulings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading client meetings on tax issues

courseDescription: Examines the unique rules applicable to federal taxation of farmers and ranchers.  Also, covers the basics on the new Limited Liability Company and Virginia law on LLCs.  Topics may vary each year.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of federal taxation rules for farmers and ranchers
Familiarity with Limited Liability Company basics
Knowledge of Virginia law on LLCs
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex tax laws and regulations
Effective communication of varied taxation topics
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of various tax laws and regulations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to organize and manage tax-related information
Understanding and application of tax law changes

courseDescription: Individually supervised research projects in selected tax areas.  Approval of supervising professor as to topic and evaluation of project required at time of registration.
